thread.title: Business in the Front, Party in the Back? Dakota Fanning Shows Us How It’s Done
thread.title_full: Business in the Front, Party in the Back? Dakota Fanning Shows Us How It’s Done

author: Maria Ward
title: Business in the Front, Party in the Back? Dakota Fanning Shows Us How It’s Done
text:
Business in the Front, Party in the Back? Dakota Fanning Shows Us How It’s Done January 10, 2017 3:34 pm Expand Photo: REX 
The phrase “business in the front, party in the back” is an old beauty adage we’re all familiar with. But last night, Dakota Fanning gave stylish new meaning to the idea on the red carpet. Where her younger sister, Elle, went the minimalist route yesterday in Los Angeles, Dakota made an equally compelling case for more-is-more abroad. Arriving to the Amsterdam premiere of Brimstone , the 22-year-old actress delivered a strong fashion statement both coming and going, courtesy of a backless Miu Miu dress that was nothing short of showstopping. 
The double-georgette design was punctuated by a 24-karat gold–flecked print that was dusted with sequins and crystal embroidery for extra sparkle. The most arresting element of the dress came in the form of a bold scooped open back, which flashed just enough skin to offset long sleeves and a trailing hem. Fanning’s secret to pulling off the daring look: forgoing the use of accessories. Because when your outfit says it all, why bother?
